message_1: Suppose you intercept a message that has been encrypted using a Caesar Cipher with a shift of 17. The encrypted message is "F L X J W J Y X H Z X M N". Determine the original message.
message_2:
To decrypt the message encrypted with a Caesar Cipher and a shift of 17, we need to reverse the process by shifting the letters back by 17 positions.

The encrypted message is "F L X J W J Y X H Z X M N".

Let's decrypt each letter:

F -> (F - 17) -> A
L -> (L - 17) -> U
X -> (X - 17) -> G
J -> (J - 17) -> S
W -> (W - 17) -> T
J -> (J - 17) -> S
Y -> (Y - 17) -> T
X -> (X - 17) -> G
H -> (H - 17) -> R
Z -> (Z - 17) -> I
X -> (X - 17) -> G
M -> (M - 17) -> Z
N -> (N - 17) -> A

The decrypted message is "A U G S T S T G R I G Z A".
